section.name: Model Driven
section.p: A "Model Driven" system is a system within which a central model is the definiative source for runtime information. Within Metro the complete deployment scenario including the component type internal datastructure is represented as a remotely accessible model. Modification of the model via local or remote invocations may have a direct impact on the application deployment or runtime state. Metro provides a suite of interfaces dealing with remote control of of the component state machine, activation policy, garbage collection policies, context state, and redepoloyment scenario information (including control over component configuration, parameterization, and individual context entry settings).
